physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph. It features two men in military uniform. They are wearing a collared short-sleeved shirt and mid-length shorts with high socks and shoes. The man on the left is sitting on a chair, with his arms crossed in front of him. The man on the right is standing with his arms by the side. They are photographed in th emiddle of a garden with bushes and several potted plants. There is a building behind them. There are no tears or folds seen on the photograph.
sgcool_label_text: A variety of portraits of British soldiers that show them at leisure as well as two photographs of James Steele placing a wreath at a remembrance ceremony, this collection is part of the archive of James Steele, Royal Artillery (Field) who served in Malaya from January 1941-February 1942, when interned as a P.O.W at Changi until his release in October 1945.
title_text: Group of 50 photographs of P.O.W James Steele and regiment when stationed in Malaysia in 1941 (and 2 later photographs of Steele placing a wreath at ceremony of remembrance)  C.S.M. Austin Sgt Davies, Echelon, Singapore 1941
subject_terms_2: World War, 1939-1945 Soldiers Portraits, Group Photography
context_7: Great Britain. Army. Royal Field Artillery
